TD4789-d-09-14-89-RFP.Accident Cause: Broken, missing, or otherwise defective springs  (including incorrect repair and/or installation)
TD4789-d-09-14-89-RFP.Narrative: AT 10:28 PM, SEP 14 1989, TRAIN R41514, ENGINES RFP121, CSX 2553, CSX 6591, RFP 122, WITH 9 LDS AND35 EMPTIES, DERAILED GATX 56073, EMPTY TANK CAR, LOADED WITH CARBON - DIOXIDE, AT MILE POST 31.8(PENOLA) ON NO.3 MAIN TRK. WHEELS R&L 1-2, LEAD TRUCK HEADING SOUTH, APPARENTLY DERAILED AT APPROXIMATELY MILE POST 39.7 (VIC BOWLING GREEN PARK) AND THE CAR WAS CARRIED TO MILE POST 31.8 BEFORE THE DERAILMENT WAS DISCOVERED AND THE TRAIN STOPPED. THE DERAILED CAR WAS THE THIRTEENTH CAR FROM THE ENGINES. THE CAR WAS RERAILED AT APPROXIMATELY 0415 HRS, SEP 15 USING MECHANICAL DEPARTMENT FORCES & CRANEMASTER. THERE WAS DAMAGE TO THE TRK, MILFORD INTERLOCKING, AND THE HOT BOX DETECTOR AT PLEASANT HILL.FOLLOW-UP INVESTIGATION REVEALED A MISSING TRUCK STABILIZING SPRING ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE LEADINGTRUCK, WHICH REDUCED THE STABILIZING EFFECT OF THE REMAINING TRUCK SPRINGS SUFFICIENTLY TO PERMIT THE CAR TO ROCK AND CAUSE WHEEL TO CLIMB AND DERAIL TO THE EAST.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

TD5089-d-09-21-89-RFP.Accident Cause: Switch damaged or out of adjustment
TD5089-d-09-21-89-RFP.Narrative: AT 12:40 P.M., THURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 21, 1989, CSX TRAIN NO. 192 ARRIVING ACCA YARD, IN CHARGE OF CSXCREW, DERAILED CSX ENGINES 7032 (R&L 1-2-3-4-5-6 WHEELS); 8164 (L 1-4-5-6 WHEELS), AND 7041 (L 4-5-6WHEELS), AT THE SOUTH END OF NO. 37 SWITCH IN "AY" INTERLOCKING. THE DERAILMENT WAS CAUSED BY WORNSWITCH POINT GUARD RAIL ALLOWING THE SWITCH POINT TO BREAK UNDER MOVEMENT. CRANEMASTER, WITH ASSISTANCE OF THE MECHANICAL DEPARTMENT FORCES, COMPLETED RERAILING OPERATIONS AT 5:45 P.M. DAMAGE TO THE ENGINE CONSIST WAS MINOR AND DAMAGE TO THE TRACK SWITCHES WAS MODERATE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

PL007-d-09-15-89-PAL.Primary Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
PL007-d-09-15-89-PAL.Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
PL007-d-09-15-89-PAL.Narrative: AT 4:00 PM, SEP 15, 1989, THE CREW OF 2:30 PM ROAD SWITCHER IN LOUISVILLE YARD, LOUISVILLE, KY, HADSWITCHED IC 745290 IN TRK #1 ON TOP OF OTHER CARS, THEN PROCEEDED WITH THEIR SWITCHING AND PLACED ANOTHER CAR ON TOP OF IC 745290 IN TRK #1. AS THEY PROCEEDED TO SWITCH TRKS #3 & 5, THEY HEARD A LOUDEXPLOSION AND RAN TO THE YARD OFFICE FOR COVER AS DEBRIS WAS FLYING THROUGH THE AIR. INVESTIGATION DEVELOPED THAT IC 745290 HAD EXPLODED BUT WAS STILL COUPLED TO THE CARS ON EACH END. THERE ERE NO PERSONAL INJURIES TO RAILROAD PERSONNEL BUT A MR. TRACY ALLEN KNIGHT, WHO IS EMPLOYED BY PARSEC, 1310 W. KENTUCKY ST., LOUISVILE, AND WHO WAS WORKING IN LOUISVILLE YARD WHEN THE CAR EXPLODED, WAS NOT SERIOUSLY. APPX 35 PEOPLE WERE EVACUATED FROM THE AREA FOR ABOUT TWO HOURS. THIS WAS A SUGGESTED EVACUATION BUT NOT MANDATORY. APPX 8 TONS OF CALCIUM CARBIDE WAS SPILLED OUT OF THE CAR BUT REPRESENTATIVES OF CARBON GRAPHITE GROUP ADVISE THE LOSS WAS NEGLIGIBLE AS THEY VACUMED UP THE SPILLAGE. CAUSE OFTHE EXPLOSION IS BEING INVESTIGATED.NoneNoneNoneNone

091889A-d-09-18-89-ATK.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 6:48 A.M., ON MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 18, 1989, AMTRAK TRAIN 802 OPERATING IN AN EASTWARDDIRECTION FROM ATTLEBORO PASSENGER STATION ON TRACK FOUR DERAILED THE WESTEND TRUCK OF COACH 522 INTHE APPROXIMATE VICINITY OF THE FACING POINT SWITCH OF CONRAIL'S MIDDLEBORO SECONDARY TRACK. AT THETIME OF THE DERAILMENT, 802 WAS ROUTED TRACK FOUR VIA THE 42 CROSSOVER TO TRACK TWO. FURTHER INVESTIGATION INDICATES COACH 522 RERAILED ITSELF ON THE TRAILING POINT SWITCH IN TRACK TWO (42 CROSSOVER). TRAIN 802 STOPPED WITH COACH 522 ON THE EXTREME EASTEND OF THE 42 CROSSOVER BY AN EMERGENCY BRAKEAPPLICATION INITIATED BY A MEMBER OF THE CREW. THE DERAILMENT OCCURED WHEN THE EQUALIZER BEAM, COACH522, WESTEND TRUCK, NORTHSIDE (WHEELS 5/7) BROKE ON THE #5 (EAST) END ALLOWING THE EQUALIZER BEAM TO DROP TO THE ROADBED IN A FACING DIRECTION. TRAIN 802 CONTINUED IN AN EASTWARD DIRECTION APPROXIMATELY 90 FEET THE POINT OF THE BEAM FAILURE (CAUSING CROSSTIE DAMAGE) TO THE VICINITY OF THE MIDDLEBORO SECONDARY SWITCH WHERE THE ACTUAL DERAILMENT TOOK PLACE.NoneNoneNoneNone
